translation.en: The new Millennium Edition Crown Royal Funeral Coach.
Because your loved one deserves the very best
[singing along to radio] ♪ I'll be home for Christmas ♪
Did you take your blood pressure medication today?
I took it. What do you want me to do, O.D. on it?
we don't have any of that soy stuff Nate drinks.
You know, since he gave up milk. I don't know what it's called.
Why not just cut some milk with tap water? He'll never know the difference.
Look, if you don't want to go, I'll go.
It's not as if I don't have enough to do already.
But it has to be after I pick up Nate at the airport,
Yes, you are, I heard you.
Look, forget you'll give yourself cancer and die a slow and horrible death.
You should not be stinking up that new hearse.
I told you not to let him take it.
He's every bit as proud of that thing as your fool brother was
of that damn motorcycle he had in high school.
And who still has a pin in his foot?
people want things to be nice when there's a funeral.
They don't want their loved ones riding around
-in something that smells like an ashtray. -All right, look, mm,
I'm quitting right now, I promise.
[clears throat] Okay? I'll see you tonight.
[song continues on radio] ♪ I'll be home ♪
Oh, that new hearse was a total waste of money.
There was nothing wrong with the old one.
I think your father's having some sort of mid-life crisis.
It would've made so much more sense to invest in repaneling for the chapel,
or adding coffee bars to the slumber rooms.
I'd much rather he buy himself a fancy new hearse
than leave me for a younger woman.
Or a woman my age, for that matter.
like my Cousin Hannah's husband did.
God sure has dealt that woman some blows in this life.
can I do anything to help?
Besides don't you have a viewing tonight?
You should probably be getting ready.
So, I enjoyed talking to you about that whole shiatsu thing.
I hope that pans out for you.
You should let me work on you sometime.
My dad was supposed to meet me here.
I could give you a ride.
That's all right, I'm sure he'll be here soon enough.
I wasn't talking about that kind of ride.
Well, she is at peace now.
If there's any justice in the universe,
-[loud music playing] -David, it's Claire. Is Nate there yet?
I thought he was coming in tonight, so we could
do that forced Christmas Eve family thing.
Because there are some excellent parties I could be going to.
This is one of the few times a year we're all together.
All right, don't get all Pat Robertson on me, I'll be there.
I have to drop some stuff off
at a friend's house before I head over, okay? Bye.
Mom, what the hell are you--
Your father is dead and my pot roast is ruined.
[woman] You carry a lot of tension around in your lower back.
[chuckles] Not as much as 20 minutes ago.
Were you ever gonna tell me your name?
Ah. That's my father looking for me.
Oh, couldn't be better in fact.
I hate to have to be the one to tell you.
I gotta spend tonight having Christmas Eve dinner with my demented family.
It'll be weird enough without me being high.
It just makes everything burn a little bit brighter.
And it makes sex, like, totally primal.
Oh, well, it's too late now.
No, he's still at the airport.
My dad just got hit by a bus
and it broke his neck and he's dead.
I gotta go pick up my mom and bring her to the morgue
so she can identify his body.
So, I guess this whole hellish experience I'm about to go through
is just gonna burn a little brighter now, right?
You really didn't have to do this. I could've just rented a car.
You're in no shape to drive.
And frankly, I'm in no hurry to get home
to my family's annual Christmas Eve massacre.
Parents who stayed together for the children,
but really because they got off on tormenting each other so much.
who always chooses the holidays to go off his medication.
Oh, and an ancient springer spaniel
who's completely blind, deaf, and incontinent.
well, he's a control freak, too.
Well, I left home right before she was born,
so I never really knew her that well, but she's kind of wild like I was.
My dad really rode my ass when I was a kid.
I couldn't go rafting 'cause he'd just buried this girl who drowned.
He buries this dipshit loser who O.D.'d at A Flock of Seagulls concert,
and suddenly I'm not allowed to go to concerts for a year.
Your dad worked in a cemetery?
How could a man who's so fucking scared of everything
or even a speeding ticket in his entire fucking life,
how could he have a car wreck?
or the fact that we're all gonna die?
So, what else do you want to talk about?
Or the fact that we both just fucked a perfect stranger?
And that we both lied when we said we never did that?
She looked so peaceful, thank you so much.
[Ruth] Did you know that before you were born,
funeral homes ran the ambulance business?
Hearses were the only vehicles that could transport people lying down.
Your father used to joke about that.
Just drive him around the block a few more times
and we won't need to stop at the hospital. [chuckles]
You're kind of freaking me out right now.
Why are you asking me this right now?
I can't even remember the last time
you and I talked about anything important.
I need to know you're okay.
I wanted to compliment you on the music.
I've been to three other funerals this year.
and the music is always that same sad organ music.
It reminds me of those soap operas my mom used to watch
before I started kindergarten. Oh, God,
you're probably too young to remember that.
Anyway, I so prefer this light classical,
but doesn't seem so dated or depressing. I studied music appreciation…
[woman's voice] You think I'm really boring, don't you?
Well, get used to it, because now that your father is dead,
you can forget about ever going law school.
It's just you and dead people and freaks like me
for the rest of your life!
this is my mom, Ruth Fisher,
Um, Nate, can I talk to you for a second?
Yeah, just give me a minute.
-Mom, did you already do the-- -I can't.
I've seen too many dead people in my life. They're work.
I won't see your father that way.
I need you to do it.
Nate, I need to talk to you now, please, it's urgent.
So, how did you and my son meet?
I have to tell somebody. I am tweaking. [breathing shakily]
I smoked some with some friends before David called me.
Don't worry, it's the first time.
But I think I'm having some kind of a meltdown,
and I can't tell if it's Dad being dead or the crystal,
You cannot do this to me right now.
Don't be such a narc, we smoked pot at Thanksgiving.
Look, I have to go identify our dead father's body.
I'm sorry you're having a bad drug experience, but deal with it.
This is what you've been running away from your whole life, buddy boy.
[clicks tongue] Scared the crap out of you when you were growing up, didn't it?
And you thought you'd escape, well, guess what? [chuckles]
Okay, let's get out of here.
Will there need to be a lot of reconstruction?
David's not that skilled at the really hard stuff.
Federico usually does that, he's quite gifted.
You don't think we'll have to have a closed casket, do you?
-I would hate to send that message. -What message?
That we're not equipped to handle a major restoration,
or that we're not proud of our work.
Mom, can we talk about this later?
We should really get Nate home, he's probably exhausted. Let's go.
I'm just avoiding my own hell.
I don't know if I can handle this.
Well, you're about to find out.
I wish you the best, Nate.
This isn't fast, you wanna see fast?
Listen, do you do a lot of drugs?
And it's none of your business.
You were driving like a maniac back there, you could've gotten us killed.
What the hell is this? You're not my father.
You split as soon as you could, you don't even know me.
So, don't start thinking you can tell me what to do, okay?
Um, he's still in the morgue.
You didn't bring him back with you?
That didn't even cross my mind.
We should've taken the van so we could bring him home.
-That was very stupid of me. -[Nate sighs]
Like she doesn't have enough to feel bad about right now?
Every second we wait will only make Dad's restoration more difficult.
But you wouldn't know about that, would you?
I'm assistant manager of organic produce
at the highest volume food co-op in Seattle.
Jesus, pull your dicks out and measure them, let's get this over with!
What were we supposed to do, throw Dad in the back of Claire's car?
Yeah, so I need to come pick up the body.
These people mean nothing to me.
[ghost] Know you not the family of the man who has slaved for you
from dawn to dark these many years?
[Scrooge] They appear to be so happy…
for skin that begs to be touched.
For the velvety appearance of actual living tissue,
There isn't anything to be afraid of, Nate.
And I'm getting him ready so his family can see him
for the last time and say goodbye to him.
You can touch him if you wear one of these.
It's good to see you. Ooh. Uh…
Really sorry about your dad, man.
But, you know, when your time's up, it's up, right?
I really appreciate you coming in on Christmas eve, Federico.
It's the least I could do for Mr. F,
I was gonna be up all night anyway,
putting together all this useless shit
Santa Claus is bringing my kid, you know?
We don't use that kind of language in here. Show some respect.
[man] Hey, listen, I just want to remind you,
don't eat too much with your family tonight, all right?
'Cause I am making you something totally decadent
Uh, hold just a second, please.
Keith, I'm sorry, I can't make it.
Because my father was just killed in a car accident.
Oh, shit, David, I'm so sorry.
Uh, nothing, thanks, but I have to stay here.
Listen, if you need anything, don't hesitate to call me.
You don't have to go through this alone.
This is the one I'm most proud of.
He got fired, flipped out… [pops lips]
…shot his wife point blank in the head,
then turned it around and shot himself in the mouth.
Some seriously closed casket shit, right?
[laughs] Like the bride and groom on top of a cake.
this right here is, this is my best work.
Wait a minute, this kid was born just like last month.
He'll be four fucking years old in April, can you believe it?
[Rico] It wasn't planned. You know what?
and he's the best thing that ever happened to me.
Keep an eye on those chemicals, Federico, we don't want him to burn.
[scoffs] Yeah, Nate, she was on top of the goddamn world.
He said not to wait up for him, we should try and get some sleep.
[scoffs] Yeah, as if that were a viable option.
You want to go to the grocery store?
Yes, anything to get out of here.
Well, it's about to start raining frogs here.
How are things on your end?
I don't know, because you, uh…
You have a calming effect on me.
Are you familiar with the psychological term "projection"?
Are you familiar with the psychological term "blow me"?
You grew up with all that psycho-babble.
You rebelled against it every chance you got, still do.
having sex with strangers in closets at airports.
And you think you're not easy to read?
Coasting by on your looks and charm
isn't working like it used to,
but you have no idea what else to do,
because you've never had to learn.
Any woman with half a brain looks at a guy like you and thinks,
"Good for a hot fuck," but believe me, that's it.
Nate, can we go home? I really gotta take a shower.
am I not allowed to have even a single moment to myself?
Nothing, no one can do anything.
You'll have to pay for that cantaloupe.
[woman] She looked her best every day of her life.
Don't let one horribly disfiguring accident change that.
Use new Wound Filler Cosmetic Molding Putty.
to help make masking unsightly wounds a breeze.
♪ She said, "Trust me, baby It'll be all right" ♪
Ma, you remember that stuffed dog I used to have?
And I dragged it around until its ears fell off,
and then you made new ears out of a dish towel.
I hated that dog after that,
and I threw it up on the roof?
And then I wanted it back and I begged Dad to go get it,
but he said no, if I really wanted it
I'd never have thrown it up there in the first place.
Your father did many wonderful things for you,
and that's all you can think of right now?
You're the worst one we've got.
It's Christmas morning, he's with his wife and kid.
I don't want you ruining my face.
-It's a little late for that. -Not funny.
I need to stay busy right now.
So, go reorganize some files or develop a new bookkeeping system.
You never really had any aptitude for this stuff.
And what did I do with my life?
I went to school to learn exactly how to do this stuff.
Other kids my age were going to frat parties,
and refashioning severed ears out of wax.
Thank God I didn't lose an ear.
I can only imagine what you'd do with that.
And I did it all for you.
[sighs] I did it to make you happy, you ungrateful son of a bitch.
Yeah, I… I just wanted to let you know I was here.
We'll deal you in next hand.
I'm about to jump out of my skin.
I'm just barely holding it together.
I don't know, am I sweating?
It's been, like, three days and I'm still trapped in zombie world.
This is all happening to you.
Sorry, but you're not the only one who wasn't prepared for this.
I came home expecting to sleep late
and chow down on mom's cooking for six days.
And now I find myself feeling like…
I'm not even a part of this family.
I'd trade places with you in a heartbeat.
What, at least you got out of here.
I live in a shitty apartment which was supposed to be temporary.
I work at a job which was also supposed to be temporary,
until I figured out what I really wanted to do with my life,
but I haven't had a relationship last more than a couple of months.
I don't even have the self-discipline to floss daily.
I've had four root canals, four!
I'm 35, I've had four root canals.
I'm gonna be one of those losers
who ends up in his death bed saying, "Where'd my life go"?
You'll be saying, "Where the hell's the morphine?"
I'm just trying to cheer you up.
I've spent my whole fucking life being cheerful.
But, he's in a much better place now.
You are so right about that.
I've known the Fishers for years from church.
I just got off duty. I came to pay my respects to your father.
You've never even met my father.
And you've met my parents how many times now?
We just spent the weekend at their house.
Don't do this to me, Keith. This is not your high school reunion.
This is not the time for you to be political.
You think that's why I'm here, to be political?
-Would you keep your voice down? -What is this? We can fuck each other
but I can't be a shoulder for you to cry on?
So, what am I, just sex to you?
Do we really have to have this conversation now?
This is Keith Charles, he's a friend of mine.
He came to pay his respects to Dad.
It's nice to meet you, Mrs. Fisher.
I'm really sorry about your husband.
I'd like to see your father now.
My Aunt Shirley was laid out here.
-Yeah, I know Shirley, I remember Shirley. -Really?
Yes, yes, I was the person who sewed her ear back on.
What, she's sad, so he has to get her out of sight?
They always do that. The second someone starts to lose it,
they take them off into that room.
It makes all the other people uncomfortable, I guess.
This is not about the other people!
When I went backpacking through Europe after I quit school,
I went to this island off the coast of Sicily.
And on the boat over, there was this pine box,
somebody from the island who was being returned to be buried there.
And there are all these old Sicilians dressed up all in black,
waiting, just lined up on the beach,
and when they got that coffin to the beach,
those old Sicilian women just went apeshit,
beating their chests, tearing at their hair,
It was just so… so real.
I mean, I'd been around funerals my entire life,
but I had never seen such grief.
And at the time, it gave me the creeps.
But, now I think it's probably so much more healthy than…
It's going to be okay, it just takes time.
I've done a terrible, terrible thing.
I'm not fine, I'm a whore!
I was unfaithful to your father for years!
And now he knows, he knows.
I met a man at church once when your father didn't come with me.
And he invited me for coffee.
And he said he liked my hair.
Well, they divorced before she died,
so, technically, I guess he's divorced.
He invited me to accompany him on a hike.
This is really not the time.
Maybe she needs to just get this out.
Well, I don't want to hear it.
I used to love hiking when I was younger and being outdoors.
I always wanted to take you kids camping,
but your father would never leave the business!
I went camping with this man from church several times!
Told your father I was visiting my sister.
Which, if he'd ever thought to call…
Can you even begin to fathom the impropriety of this?
Your husband is lying in a casket out there.
David, she's grief-stricken, okay? Fuck propriety.
I'm a friend of your brother's.
[sighs] You want me to cry on your shoulder?
Fine, my mother just confessed she was having an affair.
And now fucking Nate is in there playing Mr. Sensitive with her,
while her dead husband lies in the next room. It's disgusting.
I'll be the strong one, the stable one,
the dependable one, because that's what I do.
Everyone around me will fall apart
Hey, don't you get exhausted being so hard on everyone?
I didn't even realize how lonely I was,
or how long it had been since a man touched me like that.
Well, loneliness is a terrible thing.
I'm still a woman, you know.
And now your father sees me,
You didn't do it to hurt anybody.
If you're looking for the olives, honey, they're right here.
[man] Ashes to ashes and dust to dust,
with Franklin's new Leak-proof Earth Dispenser.
Say goodbye to soiled fingers forever.
We put the fun back in funeral.
[priest] In the midst of life we are in death.
Of whom may we see for succor, but of thee, O Lord,
who for our sins art justly displeased?
Thou knowest, Lord, the secrets of our hearts.
Shut not thy merciful ears to our prayer
but spare us, Lord most holy, O God most mighty.
Suffer us not at our last hour.
Through any pains of death to fall from thee.
In the sure and certain hope
of the resurrection to eternal life
through almighty God we commend our brother,
and we commit his body to the ground.
He looks like he's salting popcorn.
the Lord bless him and keep him,
the Lord make his face to shine upon him
The Lord lift up his countenance upon him
I refuse to sanitize this anymore.
What is this stupid salt shaker?
Huh? What is this hermetically sealed box?
This phony AstroTurf around the grave.
You can pump him full of chemicals, you can put makeup on him,
and you can prop him up for a nap in the slumber room,
that the only father we're ever gonna have is gone!
But it's a goddamn part of life and you can't really accept it
and I intend to honor the old bastard
by letting the whole world see
just how fucked up and shitty I feel that he's dead!
[all] Our Father, who art in heaven,
thy kingdom come, thy will be done,
on Earth as it is in heaven.
Give us this day our daily bread,
As we forgive those who have trespassed against us.
For thine is the kingdom and the power
and the glory forever and ever.
Mom, Federico's gonna drive you back, okay?
I just need to go over a few details with Nate.
You have such delicate hands, Federico.
Or an illustration in an antique book.
Or one of those little ceramic hands
You want to be the alpha dog, Nate, is that it?
Coasting toward mid-life with nothing to show for it
and now you want to come back
and be the rock for this family to lean on?
You want to get your hands dirty?
You sanctimonious prick, talk to me
when you've had to stuff formaldehyde-soaked cotton
up your father's ass so he doesn't leak.
Well, I'm sure you just would've tossed him out with the garbage.
It may seem weird to you,
but there is a reason behind everything that we do here.
We provide people with a very important and sacred service
at the darkest time in their lives.
Because maybe they don't want to make a spectacle of themselves.
Because maybe they'd prefer to grieve in private.
Why does it have to be such a secret? It's nothing to be ashamed of.
You had a responsibility to this family
and you ran away from it and you left it all for me.
Whoa, don't blame me if you're not living the life you want.
That is nobody's fault but your own.
Fine, just do me a favor, okay?
Excuse me. Excuse me, Mr. Fisher, sir?
If I could just get a moment of your time. What?
I'd like to talk to you about the advantages
of joining our family of death care facilities.
Sir, if you'd just hear me out--
We're not selling, now get the fuck out of here.
We wouldn't change the name of the business.
And we'd retain you as a salaried manager.
Look, I really want to hit somebody right now
and it might as well be you!
when you've had some time to recover from your loss.
You're really lucky, you know that?
It was over in a second.
I didn't have to be afraid of it, I didn't even have to think about it.
And no more having to care.
Well, after four days with my family
I'm just waiting to see if my HMO covers it.
My father's dead, my mom's a whore,
my brother wants to kill me, and my sister's smoking crack.
Four days ago, I was a relatively happy guy,
and now, it's like I don't even know who that guy was.
If you want to know the truth.
But, I think you're already aware of that.
If you ever want to, I don't know,
go out on a real date?
You know, where you buy me dinner
Maybe I'm one of those women
that meets a man who seems emotionally conflicted,
no relationship skills and I figure, "Hey, that's for me."
I don't even live here, I live in Seattle.
See, that just makes you more attractive.
Well, I also happen to be a serial rapist.
I've got ten nurses buried under my house.
Yeah, well, of course I'm here.
What do you want for breakfast?
Oh, I'm gonna go for a run. I'll eat when I get back.
You don't have to go back to Seattle right away, do you?
I could make a few calls.
♪ And if you ever change your mind ♪
♪ You know I'm not hard to find ♪
♪ And if you ever need someone ♪
♪ They tell me that success brings ♪
